metadata.dc:title: The most popular ERP-System in Sweden is developed by Jeeves
metadata.dc:description: Swedish Jeeves is "Sweden's most popular ERP-system, 2009" ahead of competitors such as SAP, Microsoft and IFS. This is shown by Exido’s annual independent study, the IT-barometer, conducted among over 1,000 Swedish companies.
metadata.dc:creator: Fgroot
metadata.field:
The cost of ownership and the ability to support business processes are two main factors that made Jeeves climb from third to first place in the category "Sweden's most popular ERP-system" this year. The result is based on the conjunction of more than 1,000 respondents' view of an ideal ERP-supplier together with their opinion on performance, competence and price of various ERP-systems.

- This confirms that our investments in low cost of ownership, flexibility and scalability are in line with companies´ demands. Customers are realizing the importance of the ERP-system's impact on their business processes and ultimately their business success, says Bengt-Åke Älgevik, CEO of Jeeves.

- I am also very glad to see that a Swedish company wins this competition. We are happy and proud.
Visma finished second, and last year’s winner Microsoft finished third.

About Exido | The IT-barometer
Twice a year, Exido conducts a survey of over 1,000 IT managers in Sweden. A part of the survey is the IT managers grading of the various suppliers. Since 2002, Exido has followed the IT market as a whole, and in its various segments. The IT barometer is considered the best source of knowledge about how the market thinks and acts in Sweden.

For more information:
Bengt-Åke Älgevik, CEO Jeeves Information Systems +46 8587 099 00, bengt-ake.algevik@jeeves.se, www.jeeves.se

Facts on Jeeves
Jeeves Information Systems AB is a leading supplier of ERP-systems, who with the products Jeeves Selected, Jeeves Universal and Garp provides companies with efficient solutions to develop and support their business processes. Jeeves ERP-system offers a wide functionality to the lowest total cost of ownership in the market*. The customers are companies with 5 to 1000 employees and are represented by approximately 4000 companies in over 40 countries. Jeeves focuses on product development while sales are performed by partners and resellers. The business started in 1992 and since 1999 Jeeves is listed on NASDAQ, OMX Nordic Exchange (Small Cap).For further information, see www.jeeves.se

* Radar Group

metadata.dc:title: Shipping Company Greenship Chooses Jeeves Universal
metadata.dc:description: Jeeves together with its partner InfoCube has closed a deal with shipping company Greenship to implement Jeeves Universal throughout its international operations. Jeeves Universal will replace several of Greenship's current ERP system solutions.
metadata.dc:creator: valentinesasha
metadata.field:
-The ERP system is the most vital component for controlling our marine cargo
processes, says Mikael Borgman, IT Manager at Greenship.Jeeves Universal
provides us with a competitive ERP system that can manage all of our international
operations. With Jeeves, we’re able to continue our expansion and develop
Greenship's business into the future.

Greenship, a subsidiary of the Björk.Eklund Group, offers global transportation
services to customers in Scandinavia and the Baltic countries. The company was
founded in 2000 and has since experienced dramatic growth. It currently has 120
employees in 7 subsidiaries. Jeeves Universal will be implemented throughout its
operations. In addition, the parent company, the Björk.Eklund Group, will use Jeeves
Universal for financial management. The initial order consists of 40 user licenses.

The deal was signed by Jeeves Information Systems' partner InfoCube.

-This deal is an important milestone for Jeeves in the transportation sector. It
highlights Jeeves' strong offering for expansive international businesses with
complex workflows, says Lars Dahlberg, Sales Director at Jeeves. We look forward
to becoming a solid partner for Greenship together with our partner, InfoCube.

For further information, please contact:

www.jeeves.se

metadata.dc:title: Jeeves strengthens functionality for master planning and inventory management through product acquisitioning
metadata.dc:description: Jeeves has acquired the two products Amase and Stockwizard from 2*PRO for the purpose of further strengthening the ERP system support for manufacturing and distributing companies. The new products are targeting small to midsize companies to gain inventory control through management by objectives and at the same time increase efficiency.
metadata.dc:creator: valentinesasha
metadata.field:
The product acquisition is part of Jeeves' strategy to strengthen its position for
manufacturing and distributing companies with software that offers high quality as
well as the leading edge.

- Amase and Stockwizard are well-tried and recognized products. With 2*PRO's
products, we can offer our customers an improved logistics solution that includes
functionality for master planning and inventory management that can be easily used
along with Jeeves, says Magnus Sjökvist, Product Director at Jeeves.

The products have functionality for master planning and advanced inventory
management. The functionality means that companies can maintain a high level of
customer service as well as a low stock inventory cost. The new tools offer support
for all the needs during a product's entire life cycle.

2*PRO has 20 years experience in the logistics business and has a customer base
with a high level of customer satisfaction. One of the reasons is the user friendliness
of their products.

-The acquisition of 2*PRO's products will favour our current and future customers
within all of our segments – distribution, manufacturing and service, says Magnus
Sjökvist.

For more information, please contact:

phone: 08-587 099 00

metadata.dc:title: Jeeves Appoints Anna Salomon-Sörensen New CFO
metadata.dc:description: Anna Salomon-Sörensen has been appointed new CFO of Jeeves Information Systems, effective October 6. Anna Salomon-Sörensen will focus on business strategy and be a member of the Executive Management.
metadata.dc:creator: valentinesasha
metadata.field:
- Anna Salomon-Sörensen is an important addition to Jeeves' Executive management team. With broad international experience, she will play a key role in the development of the processes required for the next phase of our international expansion, says Bengt-Åke Älgevik, CEO of Jeeves.

Most recently, Anna Salomon-Sörensen held the position of CFO at SIX AB (publ). During the 10 years that Anna worked for SIX, the company grew considerably both organically and through acquisitions.

-Jeeves is an exciting player in the ERP market, and I look forward to contributing to the development and growth of the company, says Anna Salomon-Sörensen, newly appointed CFO of Jeeves Information Systems.

For further information, please contact:
Bengt-Åke Älgevik, VD Jeeves Information Systems AB
e-post:bengt.algevik@jeeves.se
tel: 08-587 099 00
www.jeeves.se

metadata.dc:title: Jeeves establishes partner network in North America
metadata.dc:description: Jeeves is pleased to announce the formation of a Master Partner, Jeeves North America, for the distribution of our industry leading ERP solution in North America. Through partners Jeeves North America will market Jeeves´s ERP systems in this strategically important market. At the same time, Jeeves closes its first client deals through the new Master Partner.
metadata.dc:creator: valentinesasha
metadata.field:
– The cooperation with the co-owners at our American Master Partner gives us a
foundation for developing a partner network in North America, says Bengt-Åke
Älgevik, CEO of Jeeves. We get quick access to a sales organization with broad local
experience and professional business relations. In addition, our international
customers with operations in the USA will get improved local support. North America
is an attractive market with large long-term sales potential, offering great
opportunities for new partner recruitments.

Jeeves North America is lead by Allan Lessing, an executive with experience in
leading positions in both North America and Europe. Together with the new
management team, he has been successful in establishing a market for outside ERP
solutions in North America. Jeeves Information Systems in Stockholm owns a 15
percent share in the company.

Jeeves North America is also pleased to announce that one new Jeeves Partner has
already been established, giving Jeeves access to several important North American
areas: Los Angeles, Atlanta and Toronto.

In connection to the Master Partner agreement, two new additional customer
contracts have been signed with companies in the manufacturing sector. The orders
include a total of 100 users.

– We have since long been searching for an ERP system with extensive functionality
that meets the customer´s needs regarding flexibility, user friendliness and that easily
can be adapted to specific needs’, Allan Lessing points out. ‘We found this in Jeeves
and also found the lowest cost-of-ownership through easy upgrades.

–The establishment of a Master Partner in the North American market is in line with
our vision of becoming a leading supplier of ERP systems, says Bengt-Åke Älgevik.
To have a representation in North America is important for our growth strategy.

For more information, please contact:
Bengt-Åke Älgevik, CEO Jeeves, tel: 08 587 099 00
E-mail:bengt.algevik@jeeves.se
www.jeeves.se
Allan Lessing, CEO – Operations Jeeves North America, tel +1-905-488-0428
E-mail:alessing@jeeves-na.com
www.jeeves-na.com

metadata.dc:title: Jeeves bolsters its position in Finland
metadata.dc:description: Jeeves has signed a partnership agreement with Merit Consulting Oy in Finland. The agreement covers the sale and implementation of Jeeves’ ERP systems. This move bolsters the company’s position in the Finnish market.
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
For some time, Merit Consulting has partnered with Lawson, a U.S. supplier of ERP systems, and has extensive business in Finland. Now they are adding Jeeves’ products to their offering with the aim of expanding sales to the SME segment.

In 2009, Jeeves signed a similar agreement with Merit Consulting for the Swedish market. Bengt-Åke Älgevik, CEO of Jeeves, considers this new agreement an extension of their collaboration, giving ample opportunity to win market shares in the Nordic region.

Merit Consulting currently has 40 consultants around Finland who specialize in ERP-systems. In addition, the company has consultants in Sweden, Norway, Denmark, the UK, and the Benelux countries. The company has many years’ experience in business development for food and beverage, manufacturing and distribution companies.

For more information, please contact:
Bengt-Åke Älgevik, CEO, Jeeves Information Systems, phone: +46-8-5870-9965
E-mail: bengt-ake.algevik@jeeves.se

Jeeves Information Systems AB develops Sweden’s most popular ERP system*. The products Jeeves Selected, Jeeves Universal, and Garp offer broad functionality at a cost of ownership among the lowest in the market. Customers currently include more than 4,000 companies in more than 40 countries. metadata.dc:title: Year-end Report Jan–Dec 2009
metadata.dc:description: Sweden’s most popular ERP system grows
metadata.dc:creator: Fgroot
metadata.field:
• Revenue totaled SEK 180.4million (158.3), up 13% (22)
  • Software revenues (licenses andmaintenance) rose 6% (11)
  • Operating profit was SEK 14.3 million (16.6), giving an operating margin of 8% (10)
  • Profit after tax totaled SEK 10.1 million (13.1), giving a profit margin of 6% (8)
  • Earnings per share after tax equaled SEK 3.5 (4.6)
  • Cash flow was SEK 3.8 million (2.1), and cash, cash equivalents, and current investments totaled SEK 42.2 million (38.2)
  • The equity/assets ratio was 33% (32)
  • The Board of Directors proposes a dividend of 1.50 per share (1.50)

 

CEO’s comment on 2009 performance
Jeeves continues to grow. Sales increased 13% (22) in 2009, with sales to smaller companies
(20–200 employees) advancing the most. The rate of growth was affected by the scarcity of
major transactions in the market.

Under current market conditions, we are pleased with these results, which demonstrate Jeeves’
resilience and strength. Slower growth combined with the costs of the ongoing build-up of our
international sales channels have an impact on profitability.

In the Swedish market for ERP systems, Jeeves is consolidating its strong position. We are proud
to have been named “Sweden’s most popular ERP system,” announced in the Exido IT
Barometer in December 2009. Roughly 1,000 IT managers in Sweden participated in the survey.

The proportion of foreign transactions increased during the year, chiefly in Norway. However,
conditions are tough in several of our markets, and international growth has not met our
expectations. We foresee ongoing tentative demand for ERP systems, primarily from larger
companies (200–500 employees). Demand in this segment picks up late in the business cycle.

I have immense confidence in Jeeves. Together with our partners, we will continue to generate
new business. Our attractive and highly flexible offer provides customers with outstanding
benefits at a low cost of ownership and, combined with the investments we are making in
our sales channels, it puts us in an excellent position to gain market shares and to keep
growing profitably.


About Jeeves Information Systems
Jeeves Information Systems AB develops Sweden's most popular ERP system*. The products, Jeeves Selected, Jeeves Universal and Garp, offer wide functionality at one of the lowest total costs of ownership in the market. Customers exceed 4.000 companies in more than 40 countries. Jeeves is listed on NASDAQ OMX Nordic Exchange (Small Cap) since 1999. www.jeeves.se/en

* Exido IT-barometern 2009

 

Read the entire report.

metadata.dc:title: Interim Report Jan–Sept 2010
metadata.dc:description: Steady quarter
metadata.dc:creator: Fgroot
metadata.field:
• Revenue from continuing operations totaled SEK 130.1 million (130.0), up 0.1% (17)
  • Software revenues (licenses and maintenance) rose 7% (7)
  • Operating profit totaled SEK 8.7 million (10.4), the operating margin 7% (8)
  • Net profit totaled SEK 5.3 million (8.7), the profit margin 4% (7)
  • Earnings per share after tax equaled SEK 1.9 (3.1)
  • Cash flow ended at SEK -13.8 million (-7.3), and cash, cash equivalents, and current investments at SEK 27.5 million (31.0)
  • The equity/assets ratio was 37% (36)

 

CEO’s comment on performance
The third quarter was steady, with no major surprises. Software revenues as well as operating profit were higher in the third quarter compared with the same quarter last year. The market turnaround we saw in the first six months continued, and the SME segment continued to show lively interest in the procurement of ERP systems. New sales in Sweden were satisfactory, while sales elsewhere remained weak.

Software revenues showed a growth of 7% during the period. Services, however, were down 17% mainly due to the divestment of the operations in Jeeves’ Swedish subsidiary Reveny. Altogether this leads to a positive growth in the core business but no growth in total revenue. Jeeves’ Swedish operations posted healthy earnings thanks to positive organic growth during the period. In our international business operations, license sales did not meet expectations. Operating profit decreased, to SEK 8.7 million (10.4).

Our efforts to improve the capacity utilization of our consultants on our international projects and to adjust business operations have yielded results. In an analysis of our foreign operations, we found that the limited sales are offset somewhat by the significant role our foreign partners play in international business, by our customers gaining access to local partners who provide Jeeves know-how. I remain confident of the future, thanks to our improved list of prospects and the many international roll-outs of Jeeves ERP systems that our customers are planning in multiple countries. These factors, combined with our appealing market offering that is highly flexible and offers outstanding customer benefits at a low cost of ownership, bode well for the future.

 

Read the entire report [...]

metadata.dc:title: Success for Jeeves 2.0 – 100 upgrades since March
metadata.dc:description: Jeeves’ new versions of its Jeeves Universal and Jeeves Selected ERP systems are off to a successful start. Since the upgrades were launched in mid-March, almost 100 customers have chosen to upgrade to Jeeves 2.0, and more than 40 are already fully commissioned.
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
Jeeves Universal and Jeeves Selected 2.0 became available to customers in mid-March. One of the almost 100 companies that have already upgraded is T-Emballage, a packaging and building supplies company. IT is high on the company’s agenda, and today 25%–30% of its IT budget is dedicated to maintenance, with the remainder for development. At most companies, the reverse is true.

“Jeeves is a company that truly delivers on its promises, especially when it comes to flexibility, adaptability and smooth upgrades. Since we purchased Jeeves in 1999, we have upgraded four times, and every time it has gone smoothly and satisfied vital needs at a reasonable price. The most recent time, this past March, was exceptional. We left the office on Friday and when we came back on Monday the upgrade had been implemented and we were able to use the system as usual,” says Hans Juhlin, responsible for ERP systems at T-Emballage. “Naturally, we have a little work to do in-house before we can make full use of all the new functionality. For example, we’re going to review our processes and use Jeeves’ functions for process support so we can use our ERP solution even better.”

Jeeves 2.0 contains an array of improvements and new functions, including a new built-in process-modeling tool for describing business processes and expanding the options for adapting menus and functionality to each user’s role in the company. In addition, the upgrade comes with the market’s most sophisticated variant management function, for handling sizes, colors, qualities and the like, such as for companies in the apparel industry.


For more information:
Magnus Sjökvist, Product Director, Jeeves Information Systems
+46-8-5870-9939, magnus.sjokvist@jeeves.se, www.jeeves.se

metadata.dc:title: Jeeves signs OEM agreement with StreamServe
metadata.dc:description: – Strategically important deal opens the ERP system to improved document and information management. Jeeves and StreamServe today (Oct. 16, 2007) present a cooperation that means that Jeeves will incorporate StreamServe's Enterprise Document Presentment application into its ERP system. The agreement is deemed strategically important to Jeeves, but will not generate any immediate income effect. The cooperation enables existing and potential Jeeves customers to use StreamServe solutions for their business communication.
metadata.dc:creator: valentinesasha
metadata.field:
"The agreement with StreamServe enables existing and potential Jeeves customers to easily introduce StreamServe and Jeeves for their business communication. The agreement is part of Jeeves' strategy to always strive for effective upgrades," says Magnus Grönvik, Product Director at Jeeves.

StreamServe is a popular application for managing business documents an information flows for business communication, such as invoices in different distribution formats. Jeeves customers will now be able to enjoy these functions. The agreement with StreamServe means that existing Jeeves customers can be offered more efficient document and information management. Many of Jeeves' potential customers can also use StreamServe with their existing ERP systems.

"Business documents is a vital channel when communicating with customers and business partners. We feel that making good use of what you already know about your customers in order to individually adapt both the content and distribution channel of documents is something that should be done regardless of the size of the company. This agreement is a result of us sharing this vision with Jeeves," says Christian Hadenius, President of StreamServe in Scandinavia.

Jeeves will deliver a StreamServe basic package and max package under one OEM agreement. This enables all of the company's customers and resellers to get access to the solution.

"Jeeves' agreement with StreamServe is an important building block in our strategy for attracting bigger customers to Jeeves," says Magnus Grönvik, Product Director at Jeeves.

Jeeves intends to build a migration tool that can transfer the template of existing Jeeves customers to StreamServe. Jeeves has its own print and report management application.

For more information, please contact:

www.jeeves.se

metadata.dc:title: Elopak chooses Jeeves ERP-system
metadata.dc:description: The global Norwegian supplier of packaging systems Elopak (subsidiary in the Ferd Group), well-known for their Pure-Pak® -Packages, chooses a new ERP solution based on Jeeves Universal for the division that manufactures equipment and distributes components. The solution is sold by InfoCube who will also implement the system. The total order value is 16 MSEK.
metadata.dc:creator: Fgroot
metadata.field:
Elopak has taken a strategic decision to implement the ERP-system Jeeves
Universal in their EQS (Equipment Supply) division. The company establishes a
solution based on the new ERP-system to support all manufacturing and sales for
packaging and filling machines and for the global spare part management.

- The choice of a new ERP-system is important for the future growth and
development of EQS . With Jeeves Universal’s unique structure and low TCO
we will get a flexible but in the same time cost efficient standard system that
easily can be adapted to our needs both now and in the future, says Björn
Henrik Moshuus, CIO Elopak.

The order contains a complete installation of Jeeves Universal and an integration to
Elopak´s system for product management of filling machines.

- In today´s tough competition, I am very proud that Jeeves together with our
Swedish partner InfoCube has gained such an important Norwegian company
as Elopak as our customer. It is important for our continuous growth on the
Norwegian market. I am also happy that our new Norwegian subsidiary, Logit
gruppen, has taken their first Jeeves Universal-customers, says Bengt-Åke
Älgevik, CEO Jeeves.

The order is included in the result for Q1 (the first quarter), 2009.

Facts on Elopak
Elopak is one of the world’s leading suppliers of packaging systems for non carbonated, liquid
food. The company was established in 1957 in Norway focusing on license production of Pure-
Pak cartons. In 1987 Elopak bought Ex-Cell-O’s packaging division and hence got exclusive
global rights to the Pure-Pak-system. In 2008, The Elopak group had a turnover of 715 million
euro, more than 2500 employees (incl. joint ventures) and customers in more than 100 countries
through the company’s more than 40 offices. Elopak is fully owned by the privately owned Ferd
group. For more information, see www.elopak.com.

Facts on Ferd
Elopak is a company in the Ferd Group, a Norwegian industrial and finance group that
focuses their business to an active and long-term ownership in strong companies with
international potential and on financial investments based on the own core competence
within finance, business development and networking. Ferd is also a large investor in real
estate that develops and maintains commercial estates as well as estates for sale. For more
information, see www.ferd.no.

metadata.dc:title: Martin Tegnér new member of Jeeves management team
metadata.dc:description: - Jeeves has created the new position of Services Director in order to develop services that can more effectively support partners and resellers. Martin Tegnér, who most recently served at Ericsson, was recruited to the Services Director position. Martin Tegnér will take on his new role beginning November 5, 2007.
metadata.dc:creator: valentinesasha
metadata.field:
"Jeeves is in an expansive phase, where a lot of focus is on growth in the international channel. In order to achieve a high degree of effectiveness there, it is important that Jeeves can offer its partners a large number of well packaged support services, says
Martin Tegnér new Services Director at Jeeves.

Martin Tegnér most recently worked at Ericsson, where he served as IT Process Manager for the Service Level Management process in Group IT. Tegnér previously served as IT Service Manager North-West Europe at The Boston Consulting Group. Tegnér is 34 years old and lives in Stockholm.

"With our new Services Director function, Jeeves can support different types of partners in a more focused manner, which is necessary to enable international expansion.

Martin Tegnér has a solid background from companies such as Ericsson and The Boston Consulting Group. This background will prove to be valuable to Jeeves," says Bengt-Åke Älgevik, CEO of Jeeves.

For more information, please contact:
Bengt-Åke Älgevik, CEO of Jeeves, Tel: +46 (0)8-587 099 00
E-mail:bengt.algevik@jeeves.se

metadata.dc:title: Jeeves facilitates internationalization
metadata.dc:description: Jeeves strengthens its position as an international supplier of ERP-systems, by establishing an organization supporting the growing number of international customers. Initially Jeeves is setting up subsidiaries in Germany and United Kingdom in purpose of, together with partners, facilitating the customers’ internationalization and efficiency.
metadata.dc:creator: Fgroot
metadata.field:
- Our international client base is growing and we see an increasing need to
simplify the process of coordinating, implementing and localizing Jeeves
Universal in our customers’ subsidiaries worldwide, says Bengt-Åke Älgevik,
CEO Jeeves. This is an important step in strengthening our ability to support
larger international customers.

The subsidiaries will recruit personnel with experience of international project
management as well as knowledge of country specific ERP requirements and
business processes demands.

- Our objective is to provide partners and customers with a competent
organization able to handle the complexity of implementing an ERP system
internationally, says Bernt Olausson, Business Development Director Jeeves.

ITAB Shop Concept, who is implementing Jeeves Universal in several international
subsidiaries, will during 2009 become the first customer to benefit from Jeeves’ new
support organization.

For more information, please contact:
Bernt Olausson, Business Development Director Jeeves
Tel: +46 33 44 4104
E-mail: bernt.olausson@jeeves.se
www.jeeves.se

Facts about Jeeves Information Systems
Jeeves Information Systems AB is a leading ERP supplier with the products Jeeves Selected,
Jeeves Universal and Garp. Jeeves ERP systems provide companies with efficient solutions for
the development and support of their business processes. The Jeeves ERP systems offer a wide
functionality to the lowest total cost of ownership on the market*. It is used by around 4.000
companies in more than 40 countries. The customers are companies with 5 to 1.000 employees.
Jeeves focuses on product development while sales are performed by partners and retailers. The
company started in 1992 and since 1999 Jeeves is listed on NASDAQ OMX Nordic Exchange

metadata.dc:title: INTERIM REPORT January - September 2009
metadata.dc:creator: Fgroot
metadata.field:
Jeeves invests forward

  • Revenue totaled SEK 130.0 million (110.9), up 17% (17)
  • Software revenues (licenses and maintenance) rose 7% (11)
  • Operating profit was SEK 10.4 million (13.2), the operating margin 8% (12)
  • Profit after tax was SEK 8.7 million (10.9), the profit margin 7% (10)
  • Earnings per share after tax equaled SEK 3.1 (3.9)
  • Cash flow was SEK -7.3 million (-1.7), and cash, cash equivalents, and current investments totaled SEK 31.0 million (34.7)
  • The equity/assets ratio was 36% (36)


 

CEO’s comment on performance during the period

Jeeves continues investing. During October new versions of our Jeeves Universal and Jeeves
Selected ERP systems have been delivered. The new products primarily enhance our offer for
the distribution and manufacturing industries. Activities to strengthen our sales channels in
Sweden and internationally also remain a top priority

Sales advanced 17% (17) for the quarter, and the operating margin was 8% (12). Under
prevailing market conditions, with many colleagues in our industry reporting falling
license revenue, such results are satisfactory and demonstrate Jeeves’ resilience and
strength.

New business is being done, but few major transactions are being concluded in this market.
This is true in Sweden as well as abroad. All the same, Jeeves’ maintenance income remains
stable. Slower growth in volumes combined with the costs of the ongoing build up of our
international sales channels have adversely affected the operating margin.

As we enter the fourth quarter, the list of prospects looks better than before in Sweden
and elsewhere. However, it is hard to predict when demand will have a tangible impact on
sales and earnings, because some customers continue to delay their investment decisions.
Investments made in products and sales channels strengthen Jeeves’ well positioned
offer, which is highly flexible and has a low cost of ownership, making it appealing to customers.

 

For more information, please contact:
Bengt-Åke Älgevik, CEO Jeeves, phone: +46-8-587 099 00 or Anna Salomon.Sörensen, CFO Jeeves, phone: +46 8 587 099 45.

 

Read the entire report.

metadata.dc:title: BUFAB selects Jeeves for international roll-out
metadata.dc:description: BUFAB AB has selected Jeeves Universal for the management of the financial control in their large-scale international trade operations. Together with its partner SYSteam, Jeeves has received an order to implement the ERP-system Jeeves Universal in Sweden and in 14 international subsidiaries. The order includes approximately 70 users.
metadata.dc:creator: Fgroot
metadata.field:
- We are in need of a modern and international system that can handle the
various legal requirements that our subsidiaries in different countries are
facing, says Joakim Karlsson, financial manager at BUFAB. We have good
experience with Jeeves Universal from our production companies. Jeeves is a
natural choice as we are standardizing our IT-platform internationally. We get
an attractive combination of a competitive ERP system and a low total cost of
ownership.

BUFAB is market leading on the European market within fasteners and small parts
for the general industry. The operation is built on powerful logistic solutions with cost
effective purchases and own production. The company has 780 employees in 20
countries. BUFAB has had a strong growth during the latest years by e.g. a number
of larger acquisitions and are now establishing a common structure for the entire
business. Jeeves Universal is an important tool in this process.

- We are happy that BUFAB has chosen to expand their co-operation with
Jeeves and SYSteam as they are growing and developing their trade
operations, says Lars Dahlberg, Sales director at Jeeves. To start by creating
a group wide platform for the financial control, as in BUFAB´s case, is an
important step in our strategy to support our customers´ business operations
and internationalization.

The revenue has been booked in 2008.

metadata.dc:title: INTERIM REPORT January–March 2009
metadata.dc:description:
Jeeves’ steady growth continues
January - March 2009
metadata.dc:creator: Fgroot
metadata.field:
• Revenue reached SEK 45.7 million (34.3), up 33% (9)
  • Software revenues (license and maintenance) increased 9% (16)
  • Operating profit was SEK 4.2 million (4.8), giving an operating margin of 9% (14)
  • Profit after tax totaled SEK 4.0 million (3.2), giving a profit margin of 9% (9)
  • Earnings per share after tax were SEK 1.5 (1.1)
  • Cash flow was SEK 6.4 million (10.7), and cash, cash equivalents, and current investments totaled SEK 44.6 million (47.0)
  • The equity/assets ratio was 35% (37)
  • Thomas Wernhoff proposed as new Chairman of the Board

 

CEO’s comment on performance

I remain satisfied with Jeeves’ progress. Despite the recession, we are maintaining steady
profitability and sales growth. We are proud to have reported a profit for every single quarter for
the past seven years.

We are seeing somewhat slower growth in demand for ERP systems because of the state
of the economy. Yet underlying demand and the need for ERP systems remains healthy, and we
have a steady stream of new prospects.

During the quarter, Jeeves made fewer sales, but there were more major transactions than in
the preceding quarter. Several billion-dollar enterprises have chosen Jeeves’ ERP systems.
In addition to Swedish sales, several new orders were secured by a few international partners.

Activities to strengthen our position and our international sales channels remain a high
priority, because international expansion is essential if Jeeves is to continue growing in the
long run.

Jeeves’ financial strategy, to achieve healthy growth with balanced profit while maintaining a
strong balance sheet, is an advantage in these times. Seven years of profitability show the longterm
benefits of Jeeves’ business model, in which we and our partners together construct an
offer attractive to the market.


Facts about Jeeves
Jeeves Information Systems AB is a leading supplier of enterprise resource planning (ERP) systems that provides companies with efficient solutions for developing and supporting their business processes through its products Jeeves Selected, Jeeves Universal, and Garp. Jeeves’ ERP systems offer broad functionality at a total cost of ownership that is the lowest in the market*. Customers are companies with 5 to 1,000 employees, spread among approximately 4,000 companies in more than 40 countries. Jeeves focuses on product development, while its partners and resellers handle sales. Operations began in 1992, and since 1999 Jeeves has been listed on the small companies list of NASDAQ OMX Nordic in Stockholm (Small Cap). For more information, see www.jeeves.se.

* Radar Group

metadata.dc:title: Interim report January - September 2007
metadata.dc:description: - Jeeves' best quarter yet
metadata.dc:creator: valentinesasha
metadata.field:
January – September 2007

  • Revenue totalled 94.5 (85.0), an increase of 11% (30)
  • Program revenue (licensing and maintenance) increased by 10% (35)
  • Net operating income was MSEK 12.9 (8.9) and the operating margin totalled 14% (11)
  • Earnings after tax amounted to MSEK 10.7 (6.8) and the income margin was 11% (8)
  • Per-share earnings after tax were SEK 3.6 (2.3)
  • Cash flow was MSEK 2.1 (1.5), including dividend and buyback of own shares totalling MSEK 13.3 and liquid assets and short-term investments totalling MSEK 32.1 (29.7)


CEO comments on the results
Third quarter earnings made it the absolute best quarter yet for Jeeves. Fourth quarter prospects are promising. All Group companies have shown a positive earnings trend during the third quarter. Earnings must be considered from a perspective where good license sales combined with three months of maintenance revenue (Jeeves' largest form of revenue) and lower operating costs during vacation months had a positive effect on margins.

I consider Jeeves' good result satisfying, but emphasize the importance of continuing to drive Jeeves toward further improved growth, particularly with a focus on larger customers, larger partners in more countries and acquisitions.

metadata.dc:title: Jeeves Information Systems and Pagero sign agreement on e-invoices
metadata.dc:description: Jeeves Information Systems and Pagero have entered into a global agreement that enables Jeeves customers to send and receive electronic invoices with the help of Pagero Connect.
metadata.dc:creator: valentinesasha
metadata.field:
The agreement gives Jeeves customers access to Pagero's electronic invoice management solution. The Pagero e-invoice service is Web-based. It administrates communication and identifies, converts, archives and forwards all types of invoices. Lower administration costs, faster payments, improved cash flow and increased security are the gains. The environment is also a winner as use of paper is reduced.

  "Requirements for e-invoices are continually increasing. Jeeves has customers with businesses where it is vital that we can offer this type of administration," explains Ann-Cathrin Jerrelind, Project Manager at Jeeves. "The collaboration with Pagero gives us access to all standard formats that currently exist for e-invoices. In the future there will also be access to new formats for support abroad. The e-invoice solution has a quick set-up and makes management of both customer and supplier invoices cost effective for our customers."

   "We are pleased that Jeeves chose our solution. We have no doubt that ERP systems that quickly supply simple solutions for electronic invoices will gain a competitive edge," says Fredrik Rosenqvist, CEO of Pagero AB.

Sending electronic invoices is one way to save natural resources. In Europe alone, electronic invoicing would produce an annual savings of 20 billion letters, 400,000 tons of paper, 12-16 million trees, 2,700 tons of ink, 165 liters of diesel and 1350 GWh of energy if implemented everywhere.


For more information, please contact:
Ann-Cathrin Jerrelind, Project Manager at Jeeves Information Systems AB
Tel: +46 (0)8 587 09 991ann-cathrin.jerrelind@jeeves.se

Fredrik Rosenqvist, CEO of Pagero AB
Tel: +46 (0)31 600 730fredrik.rosenqvist@pagero.com

Facts about Jeeves Information Systems
Europe's fastest-growing ERP system vendor*, Jeeves Information Systems AB develops ERP systems for companies that are active within the manufacturing, retail, service and maintenance sectors. The company focuses on product development, while sales are channelled through partners and resellers. The Group collaborates with close to 70 partners globally. Partners are represented in around twenty locations in Sweden.
The company's principal products are Jeeves Enterprise and Garp, which are installed at over 3,900 companies. Current operations were initiated in 1992; the company has been listed on the Stockholm Stock Exchange since 1999.

* According to Gartner, August 2006

About Pagero AB
Pagero has delivered secure and competent payment programs to companies since the beginning of the 1990s. Since the company's founding, Pagero programs have been sold to tens of thousands of companies around Scandinavia. The company now also offers total solutions in electronic invoices for small, midsize and large companies, both locally and on a global level. Pagero solutions increase efficiency, improve security, reduce average credit time and help to minimize reliance on natural resources at no extra cost. The headquarters are in Gothenburg. www.pagero.com

metadata.dc:description: The family business Väderstad-Verken has more than doubled its turnover during the last two years to 1.4 billion SEK. The company is in need of a flexible ERP system to enable a continuous growth and therefore changes to the ERP system Jeeves Universal through the Jeeves partner Infocube. The order includes 250 users and is one of Jeeves' larger orders in 2008.
metadata.dc:creator: valentinesasha
metadata.field:
– With such a substantial growth, we foresee Jeeves Universal to facilitate our continuous expansion. We chose Jeeves mainly because of its high level of flexibility and user-friendliness compared to many other systems, says Anders Karlsson, CIO at Väderstad-Verken.

Väderstad-Verken has been selling agricultural machines since 1962 and is one of Europe's leading companies within soil processing and sowing. The company, which is a Gazelle company and was nominated for the Swedish Trade Council's Big Export Price 2008, has a total of 750 employees and subsidiaries in twelve countries.

– Väderstad-Verken is a great example of a customer where the strengths of Jeeves Universal, especially the flexibility, come to its full potential. It is very gratifying that Väderstad-Verken values the full capacity of our powerful ERP system,
says Lars Dahlberg, Sales Director at Jeeves.

The order has been signed by Jeeves Information Systems’ partner InfoCube.

– We are proud of the shown confidence by the customer and can confirm that our long-term focus at Jeeves really matters. Väderstad-Verken has pursued its procurement in an exceptionally professional way with a strong internal support for the project, which is a guarantee for a successful project. We see this as the first step on a journey where we expect to grow at the same pace as Väderstad-Verken, says Jonas Hammarberg, Marketing and Sales Director at InfoCube.

metadata.dc:title: Jeeves Selected makes it easier for companies to grow
metadata.dc:description: Now growth companies can continue their success and grow without having to change ERP system. Jeeves launches the ERP system Jeeves Selected – a solution targeting small growth companies (5-50 employees). Jeeves Selected handles both the simple needs of small businesses as well as the complex needs of large companies.
metadata.dc:creator: valentinesasha
metadata.field:
The choice of ERP system is critical for a company´s ability to establish growth and competitive advantage. As the operation expands, many small growth companies face new obstacles. Their existing ERP system lacks the potential for expanded functionality, operational support, and improved reporting. At the same time new suppliers and customers demand integration with external systems. An upgrade of their existing ERP system is often inevitable.

- ”Changing ERP system demands a large investment and a great effort from a small company in growth, whilst facing the risk to lose business focus”, says Daniel Göhlin, responsible for Jeeves Selected sales. “When a company invests in Jeeves Selected it’s the last time they change ERP system”.

Jeeves Selected offers a modern and flexible ERP system, adapted to fit the small company´s central needs. As the operation expands, new functionality can gradually be added to the initial solution in order to fit new requirements from the company´s users, suppliers and customers. Finally, the company is ready to grow into Jeeves Universal, a full-fledged ERP system for mid-sized companies (50-1000 employees).

Jeeves Selected is built on the same platform as Jeeves Universal. The common platform makes it possible to avoid the traditional system change and instead allows for seamless growth into the larger system.

- ”With Jeeves Selected/Universal, we are the first to offer seamless growth between two ERP systems for different target groups”, accentuates Lars Dahlberg, Sales Director at Jeeves. “That is something no one else can offer”.

With Jeeves Selected, Jeeves strengthens its position in the entire SME-segment. The system´s adaptation to fit needs of small growth companies is an important complement to Jeeves Universal aimed toward mid-sized companies. Small-sized companies with 5-49 employees constitute about 75 percent of all companies in the SME-segment (5-1000 employees) and have proven strong growth during the last five years. During last year, more than 50 percent of all small-sized companies grew more than 25 percent measured in net sales. Many companies also showed good profit.*

Jeeves Selected is available on the market starting May, 2008.

* according to UC, Sweden

For more information, please contact:

metadata.dc:title: Jeeves acquires company in Norway
metadata.dc:description: ERP system supplier Jeeves has signed a letter of intent on May 14 regarding the acquisition of all shares in the Norwegian company Logistikk-og-IT Partner A/S (LogIT Gruppen). The deal is an important step in Jeeves’ growth strategy and means that the company strengthens its position on the Norwegian market.
metadata.dc:creator: valentinesasha
metadata.field:
The Norwegian company LogIT Gruppen owns, develops and sells ERP systems with the emphasis on small and midsize companies on the Norwegian market. The company’s own ERP system Lösning1 has around 100 customers, mainly within the trade sector. A related consultancy is run alongside the ERP system. In 2007, LogIT Gruppen had a turnover of 30 MNOK and the number of employees was 20. The company has offices in Oslo, Bergen, Trondheim and Molde.

The Norwegian market for small and midsize companies is interesting. According to Proff/Norge, there are around 37.000 limited companies in the 10-999 employee segment, which is around 75% of the number of corresponding companies in Sweden, according to UC Sverige. The bottom part of the segment with 10-49 employees is even a bit larger than the Swedish market.

- Moving our position forward on the Norwegian market is an important step towards reaching our growth objectives, says Bengt-Åke Älgevik, CEO Jeeves. The acquisition gives us a strong base for new sales, but we also have around 50 existing customers in Norway that we now have a better opportunity to develop together with our partners. For LogIT Gruppen, the acquisition means that they now better can meet the customer's requirements, among other things.

- We see great advantages with Jeeves as the owner. Together with Jeeves we get a better chance to further develop our business, short term as well as long term, says Tore Husby, CEO at LogIT Gruppen. To be able to offer our customers Jeeves' modern ERP systems that can easily be adopted to suit their specific needs are important factors in our decision. Jeeves’ flexibility and low cost of ownership will be attractive to our customers and the Norwegian market. The acquisition process, including due diligence, is expected to be completed at the end of May and the beginning of June. A performed acquisition is estimated to increase Jeeves’ annual turnover with around 35 MSEK and have a positive effect on earnings per share.

For more information, please contact:
Bengt-Åke Älgevik, CEO Jeeves, tel: +46-8-587 099 00
E-mail:bengt.algevik@jeeves.se

Tore Husby, CEO LogIT Gruppen, tel +47-957-50-429
E-mail:tore.husby@logitgruppen.no

Facts about Jeeves Information Systems
Europe´s fastest growing supplier of ERP-systems*. The Jeeves Information Systems AB group of companies develops ERP systems for companies within the manufacturing, trade, maintenance and service sectors. Jeeves concentrates on product development, while sales are channeled through partners and resellers. In total Jeeves has around 70 partners globally. In Sweden partners are represented on 20 locations. The main products are Jeeves Universal, Jeeves Selected and Garp, all in all installed at over 3 900 companies. The present operations started in 1992 and the company has been listed on the Stockholm Stock Exchange since 1999.
www.jeeves.se

* According to Gartner, August 2006

Facts about LogIT Gruppen
LogIT Gruppen is a leading supplier of ERP solutions and system integration, mainly to trading companies and service companies, with around 200 customer installations. The ERP system Lösning1 has for almost 20 years been effectively supporting the customers’ businesses. LogIT Gruppen has offices in Oslo, Bergen, Trondheim and Molde with customers throughout entire Norway. Starting from our message - Your expectations, our responsibility –we wish to provide for deliveries with responsibility and quality that meets your expectations.
www.logitgruppen.no

metadata.dc:title: Year-End Report 2008
metadata.dc:description:
Jeeves boosts sales despite tough times
January–December 2008
metadata.dc:creator: Fgroot
metadata.field:
•    Revenue reached SEK 158.3 million (130.1), up 22% (9)

•    Software revenues (license and maintenance) increased by 11% (10)

•    Operating profit was SEK 16.6 million (18.4), giving an operating margin of 10% (14)

•    Profit after tax totaled SEK 13.1 million (14.8), giving a profit margin of 8% (11)

•    Earnings per share after tax were SEK 4.6 (5.0)

•    Cash flow was SEK 2.1 million (6.3), and cash, cash equivalents, and current investments totaled SEK 38.2 million (36.3)

•    The equity/assets ratio was 32% (34)

•    The Board of Directors proposes a dividend of SEK 1.50 per share (1.50)

CEO’s comment on earnings
Jeeves is reporting a healthy profit for full-year 2008, with revenues from software rising 13% in the fourth quarter. Operating profit weakened, however, chiefly owing to costs of establishing business abroad.

I am satisfied with Jeeves’ 2008 sales growth of 22% (9). Our Norwegian acquisition contributed to healthy growth during the year. Jeeves continues to sell and sign up new customers despite the economic slowdown. The number of new customers was 20% more in 2008 than in 2007.

Jeeves’ international initiatives continue. We are pleased that our foreign partners are contributing a growing proportion of revenues as a whole, even though some markets have been slower than last year.

In my judgment, the underlying demand for ERP systems remains strong. Today, companies are prioritizing investments to boost efficiency, and a modern ERP system plays a vital role there. However, nowadays new sales are being made by only a few actors. Jeeves is one of these, and we are well-positioned offering top-class ERP systems at the lowest cost of ownership in the market. We see keen interest in the market and enter 2009 with a large pipeline. Despite this, uncertainty concerning the economic outlook makes sales forecasts more difficult than previously.

metadata.dc:title: Peab creates efficient growth with Jeeves
metadata.dc:description: Jeeves Information Systems has received an order from Peab PGS to deliver the ERP system Jeeves Universal as an important part of the company’s industrial manufacturing process of apartment blocks. Initially, the order includes approximately 60 users and was won in cooperation with Jeeves’ partner SYSteam.
metadata.dc:creator: Fgroot
metadata.field:
Peab PGS AB is a subsidiary within the construction group Peab. The company
started in 2007. Peab develops and delivers a complete building system for
apartment blocks which includes product development, manufacturing, delivery and
assembly. Residences will be built in a completely new way, which will result in
higher quality and lower costs.

Industrial construction is a strategically important venture for Peab. Jeeves Universal
fulfills Peab’s high demands of a flexible standard system able to secure precision in
logistics and manufacturing of residences.

- I am glad to say that Peab, in spite of the financial crises and its effect on the
construction businesses, is prioritizing a long term investment for their
operations. This proves that Jeeves creates possibilities to grow even in a
recession – mainly because we offer the market a competitive alternative at a
low total cost of ownership, says Lars Dahlberg, Sales Director Jeeves.

Jeeves Universal will be implemented in several of Peab PGS´ key processes:
planning, purchasing, manufacturing and assembly. Together with product
development and configuration systems, Jeeves will form the base for the company’s
industrial construction system. A pilot version of the system was delivered in the
autumn of 2008. The implementation is planned to be completed in September 2009.

For further information, please contact:
Lars Dahlberg, Sales Director Jeeves, +46 8 587 099 68
e-mail: lars.dahlberg@jeeves.se
www.jeeves.se

Bengt Jansson, CEO Peab PGS, +46 431 894 52
e-mail: bengt.jansson@peab.se
www.peab.se

Carl-Magnus Wibring, SYSteam, +46 36 14 91 17
e-mail: calle.wibring@systeam.se
www.systeam.se

Facts about Jeeves Information Systems
Jeeves Information Systems AB is a leading ERP supplier with the products Jeeves Selected,
Jeeves Universal and Garp. Jeeves ERP systems provide companies with efficient solutions for
the development and support of their business processes. The Jeeves ERP systems offer a wide
functionality to the lowest total cost of ownership on the market*. It is used by around 4.000
companies in more than 40 countries. The customers are companies with 5 to 1.000 employees.
Jeeves focuses on product development while sales are performed by partners and retailers. The
company started in 1992 and since 1999 Jeeves is listed on NASDAQ OMX Nordic Exchange
(Small Cap). For more information, please visit www.jeeves.se.
* Radar Group

Facts about SYSteam
SYSteam works as a strategic and complete IT supplier and offers services within management,
engineering, ERP systems, system development/integration and technical infrastructure and
operation. SYSteam is a complete supplier to small and midsize companies as well as a
specialist to larger companies and selected trades. This specialist knowledge is also offered to
the SME-segment. Thorough knowledge of the customer’s business and processes together with
comprehensive IT knowledge makes it possible for SYSteam to provide business benefit.
SYSteam has offices and subsidiaries at around 40 places throughout northern Europe, employs
around 1,250 people and is owned by the Norwegian ErgoGroup. For more information:
www.systeam.se

metadata.dc:title: Interim Report January– September 2008
metadata.dc:description: Jeeves delivers profitable growth
metadata.dc:creator: valentinesasha
metadata.field:
January – September 2008
•    Turnover amounted to SEK 110.9 million (94.5) and increased by 17% (11)
•    Software revenues amounted to SEK 91.3 million (82.3) and increased by 11% (10)
•    The operating profit was SEK 13.2 million (12.9) and the operating margin was 12% (14)
•    Net results after tax amounted to SEK 10.9 million (10.7) and the net margin 10% (11)
•    Earnings per share after taxes were SEK 3.9 (3.6)
•    The cash flow was SEK –1.7 million (2.1) including the dividend and cash and current investments amounted to SEK 34.7 million (32.1)
•    The equity/assets ratio amounted to 36% (36)



CEO’s comments on the results
Jeeves has delivered profitable growth for 6.5 years in every individual quarter. We continue to win new customers and our customer base is growing. Sales in the third quarter were solid. The share of consultancy revenues grew, primarily related to the acquisition of the Norwegian company LogIT Gruppen.

During the third quarter, we sold the first licenses for Jeeves Selected, aimed at small, high-growth enterprises. Our recent Norwegian acquisition, together with our other international business activities, developed favorably.

We see a solid underlying demand for ERP systems in that many customers still have outdated solutions. Uncertainty regarding trends in the economy makes estimates of sales somewhat harder to predict. At the same time we see new opportunities in the fact that we provide the system with the lowest cost of ownership on the market when investments in rationalization are prioritized.


Read the enire report

metadata.dc:title: Interim Report January - June 2008
metadata.dc:description: Continued growth for Jeeves ERP
metadata.dc:creator: valentinesasha
metadata.field:
January – June 2008

  • Turnover amounted to SEK 73.3 million (63.5) and increased by 16% (12)
  • Software revenues (license and maintenance) increased by 11% (10)
  • The operating profit was SEK 8.6 million (5.6) and the operating margin was 12% (9)
  • Net results after tax amounted to SEK 6.0 million (5.2) and the net margin was 8% (8)
  • Earnings per share after taxes was SEK 2.1 (1.7)
  • The cash flow was SEK 4.7 million (6.1) and cash and current investments amounted to SEK 41.0 million (36.1)
  • The debt-equity ratio was 30% (40)
  • Norwegian LogIT Gruppen has been acquired during the period. The acquisition is expected to have a positive effect on the result for 2008


CEO’s comments on the results

Jeeves’ success continues! Again we’ve achieved the best half-year result ever, and in combination with an improved increase in turnover. It is becoming increasingly evident that the market understands and appreciates those strengths that single out Jeeves’ ERP system – adaptability, user-friendliness as well as the very low cost of ownership.

We have continued to work on increased growth during the second quarter:

  • The acquisition of Norwegian LogIT Gruppen has been received well both by the organization in Norway and by the market. We see a positive influx of ”prospects”.
  • We have made more business in the whole SME segment (5-1000 users) than we have done before. With our new ERP solutions, Jeeves Universal and Jeeves Selected, for large and smaller companies respectively, we strengthen our position in the entire segment
  • Our international operations are developing positively. The prospect situation continues to be good both for our Swedish and our international partners.


I continue to feel confident for the future development of Jeeves!


For more information please contact:
Group CEO Bengt-Åke Älgevik, +46 8 587 099 00 or CFO Magnus Björnum, +46 8 587 099 45


Read the entire report

metadata.dc:title: HL Display opts for Jeeves’ ERP system worldwide
metadata.dc:description: HL Display was looking for an ERP system that could support its global business model more efficiently and discovered that it already had the solution. HL Display is going to redeploy Jeeves Universal to support its operations in 34 countries. The number of users will increase, from 400, to 500. The transaction was arranged by Jeeves’ partner SYSteam.
metadata.dc:creator: Fgroot
metadata.field:
This transaction entails a bundled product offering for HL Display’s global organization and includes orders, inventory, purchasing, invoicing, production, and more. The global business model also means that the internal logistics chain between production, distribution, and sales companies will be overhauled from the ground up, which will demand a redeployment.

“The purpose is to boost efficiency in every activity in the company. The choice of ERP system was crucial to us, because it is what enables us to execute our global business model. Jeeves Universal fulfills all the demands we’ve made and is an ERP system we’ve had great confidence in for some time,” says Fredrik Birkhammar, CIO, HL Display.

“As far back as in 1997, HL Display began to use Jeeves ERP systems, making them one of our oldest customers. Naturally, we’re extremely proud they’ve shown this renewed trust in us,” says Johan Krantz, Sales Director, Jeeves Universal.

HL Display is expert in merchandising and in-store communication and supplies products and solutions to customers in the food and non-food retail sectors as well as to brand manufacturers. The company has sales of approximately SEK 1.4 billion (2009) and has operations in 34 countries with 1,100 employees.

The transaction was recognized in the accounts for the fourth quarter of 2010.

 

For more information, please contact:
Johan Krantz, Sales Director, Jeeves Universal
+46-704-801-867
johan.krantz@jeeves.se

metadata.dc:title: Life science company LinkMed chooses Jeeves’ ERP system
metadata.dc:description: Life science company LinkMed has chosen Jeeves Universal as its new ERP system for its own business operations and for its subsidiaries Olerup SSP AB and AbSorber AB. The deal was arranged by Jeeves’ partner Omnilog.
metadata.dc:creator: cecilia
metadata.field:
The deal consists of a bundled product offering that includes inventory, purchasing, production, orders, invoicing, accounting, and project management.

“At the same time as we changed our focus, we decided to review our ERP systems. Using a single ERP system for the entire organization has many advantages. Jeeves Universal supports our global organization, is flexible, and boosts our efficiency,” says Yvonne Axelsson, CFO, LinkMed.

Consultants from Jeeves’ partner Omnilog will implement the solution, which is expected to be ready in spring 2011.

“Omnilog has really succeeded in demonstrating the synergies LinkMed will gain by using one ERP system throughout its organization. We are proud to have LinkMed as our new customer,” says Johan Krantz, Sales Director, Jeeves Universal.

LinkMed has 10 portfolio companies in pharmaceuticals research, biotechnology, diagnostics, and medical technology. The subsidiaries Olerup SSP and AbSorber conduct research, development, and production in the field of transplantation. LinkMed is listed on the small companies list of NASDAQ OMX Stockholm (Small Cap).


For more information, please contact:

Yvonne Axelsson, CFO, LinkMed

yvonne.axelsson@linkmed.se

metadata.dc:title: Jeeves completes acquisition in Norway
metadata.dc:description: ERP system supplier Jeeves completes the acquisition of all shares in the Norwegian Logistikk-og-IT Partner A/S (LogIT Gruppen).
metadata.dc:creator: valentinesasha
metadata.field:
After conducting due-diligence, Jeeves takes over all shares in the Norwegian LogIT
Gruppen. The purchase price has been specified to a cash payment equivalent of 6,2
MNOK. In addition, there is a payment linked to established income objectives during
2008-2010. If these are met, a payment of another 8 MNOK will take place. The
acquisition is self-financed.

The acquisition agreement is a result of the letter of intent that was signed on May
14, 2008. (Please refer to previous press release dated May 14, 2008). The take-over
will be effective as of June 2, 2008.

Norska LogIT Gruppen owns, develops and sells ERP systems with the emphasis on
the small and midsize companies on the Norwegian market. The deal is an important
step in Jeeves’ growth strategy and signifies a strengthening of its position on the
Norwegian market.

In 2007, the LogIT Gruppen had a turnover of 30 MNOK and the number of
employees was 20. The company has offices in Oslo, Bergen, Trondheim and Molde.
The acquisition is estimated to increase Jeeves’ annual turnover with around 35
MSEK and to have a positive effect on earnings per share.

For more information, please contact:
Bengt-Åke Älgevik, CEO Jeeves, tel: +46-8-587 099 00

metadata.dc:title: Jeeves appoints new CEO of Norwegian subsidiary
metadata.dc:description: Jeeves has appointed Torulf Nilsson as CEO of its Norwegian subsidiary LogIT Gruppen, effective as of February 1, 2009. Jan Torulf Nilsson most recently held a position at Lawson, where he was a member of the Norwegian management team.
metadata.dc:creator: valentinesasha
metadata.field:
Torulf Nilsson is Swedish, but has over 20 years of experience of the Norwegian ERP
market where he has been involved in the introduction of several ERP systems. He
leaves a position in the Norwegian management team of Lawson as responsible for
Solution Consulting in Norway and Finland.

-Torulf Nilsson will ensure a successful development of our Norwegian subsidiary.
His deep knowledge and experience of selling complex ERP systems and his ability
to understand customer needs will become key assets to Jeeves, says Bengt-Åke
Älgevik, CEO of Jeeves.

Jeeves acquiredLogIT Gruppenin June, 2008. LogIT Gruppen owns, develops and
sells ERP systems aimed at small- to medium-sized Norwegian businesses. The deal
was an important part of Jeeves’ growth strategy and strengthens its position in
Norway.

-I’m impressed by Jeeves’ successes on the Swedish market and l look forward to
the challenge of expanding Jeeves to Norway. With Jeeves´ strengths, such as low
TCO and flexibility, I foresee great potential to expand the Norwegian customer
base, says Jan Torulf Nilsson.

For more information, please contact:
Bengt-Åke Älgevik, CEO Jeeves, tel: +46 (0)8-587 099 00
E-mail:bengt.algevik@jeeves.se

metadata.dc:title: Alignment Systems chooses Jeeves
metadata.dc:description: – Jeeves partner SYSteam replaces ASW in big deal. With the help of its partner SYSteam, Jeeves received an order from Alignment Systems for most modules of the Jeeves ERP system. Alignment Systems is a world-leading manufacturer of equipment for the repair and inspection of damaged vehicles. The deal is one of Jeeves' biggest deals so far this autumn.
metadata.dc:creator: valentinesasha
metadata.field:
"Alignment Systems is in an exciting phase of growth. We are replacing ASW with Jeeves to obtain a system that is flexible and upgradable while being cost effective," says Johan Mattsson, CFO of Alignment Systems.

Alignment Systems will use most modules of the Jeeves ERP system, such as Production, Order, Inventory, Invoicing, Service and Projects. Alignment Systems will also use the newer functions for Shop Floor Control and Intra Company Transactions. Approximately 85 people will work in Jeeves and another large number of people will use Shop Floor Control functionality and the attendance system.

"The deal with Alignment is one of our bigger deals to date this autumn and shows Jeeves' strength in being able to attract big deals and customers. Naturally, we are happy that more and more companies are discovering the advantages of Jeeves and are replacing their old ERP system," says Lars Dahlberg, Sales Director at Jeeves.

The deal was struck by Jeeves' partner SYSteam.

"Introduction of Jeeves at Alignment Systems has the potential to generate many business gains. The largest individual improvements will most likely be found in areas associated with production and flows within the Group, that is to say inter-company trade (ICT)," says Mikael Brodin, Unit Manager at SYSteam.

For more information, please contact:
Lars Dahlberg, Sales Director at Jeeves, Tel: +46 (0)8-587 099 00
E-mail:lars.dahlberg@jeeves.se
www.jeeves.se

 

Mikael Brodin, SYSteam, Tel: +46 (0)70 342 24 32
E-mail:mikael.brodin@systeam.se

metadata.dc:title: 20 new customers when Jeeves targets smaller growing companies
metadata.dc:description: The ERP-system Jeeves Selected, targeting smaller growth companies, was released in 2008 and has already gained 20 new customers. The key is a fully integrated ERP-system tailored to the smaller companies´ functionality demands and easily adapted to their growth.
metadata.dc:creator: Fgroot
metadata.field:
Djurås Verkstad in Dalarna is one of the first companies to have installed Jeeves
Selected. Since the end of 2008 the new system is used throughout the entire
business. Maria Vestlund, CFO says:

- We outgrew our old system. We couldn’t improve our business further and we
lacked control over our flows since most of the work was done manually. Now
I have a complete support for the business and an overview of the company
from purchasing and inventory to sales and invoicing without an increase in
administration. This is important if we want to develop further.

Jeeves Selected is specially made to meet the competent business support demands
of smaller growing companies’ (5-25 users). Many companies in the target group
have access to a financial system, but lack support to efficiently plan and run their
operations. Jeeves Selected is an adapted version of the larger Jeeves Universal
and brings financials, operations and business planning together in one solution for
the smaller company. Since the system is built on the same platform as Jeeves
Universal, the companies can grow without having to worry about their ERP-solution.

- With Jeeves Selected we have succeeded in something that our competitors
have not – giving the smaller companies access to a fully integrated ERPsystem
that they can grow and develop with without having to change system
as the business gets more complex and the number of users grow. The
advantage of Jeeves is that we have a common platform for the small and the
big system. And above all, we and our partners have experience and
knowledge of the smaller companies’ needs, says Magnus Sjökvist, Product
Director Jeeves.

The Jeeves Selected investment is focused on trading and manufacturing
companies. During 2009 a solution for variant management for the clothing industry
will be launched.

Facts on Jeeves Information Systems
Jeeves Information Systems AB is a leading supplier of ERP-systems, who with the products
Jeeves Selected, Jeeves Universal and Garp provides companies with efficient solutions to
develop and support their business processes. Jeeves ERP-system offers a wide functionality to
the lowest total cost of ownership in the market*. The customers are companies with 5 to 1000
employees and are represented by approximately 4000 companies in over 40 countries. Jeeves
focuses on product development while sales are performed by partners and resellers. The
business started in 1992 abd since 1999 Jeeves is listed on NASDAQ, OMX Nordic Exchange
(Small Cap). For further information, see www.jeeves.se
